text.tspan: Humans look over your code to find your mistakes.
Mistakes are caught during the development phase, before anybody is affected.
Code review is systematic examination (often as peer review) of
computer source code intended to find and fix mistakes overlooked
in the initial development phase, improving both the overall quality
of software and the developers' skills.
Helps contributors to provide better patches.
Anybody can review code, not just core developers.
